sentences: Dong Young-bae (Korean: 동영배; born May 18, 1988), better known by his stage names Taeyang (meaning "sun" in Korean) and SOL (when performing in Japan), is a South Korean singer, songwriter and dancer.
section: N/A

sentences: After appearing in Jinusean's music video "A-yo", Taeyang began training under YG Entertainment at the age of 12.

sentences: Six years later, he made his debut in 2006 as a member of the South Korean boy band Big Bang.
section: N/A

sentences: While the quintet's debut was met with lukewarm receptions, their follow-ups cemented their popularity, becoming one of the best-selling digital group of all-time in Asia and one of the best-selling boy bands in the world.
section: N/A

sentences: Following the release of several albums and extended plays with his group, Taeyang pursued a solo career in 2008, releasing his first extended play, Hot.

section: N/A

sentences: Hot was followed by his first full-length studio album, Solar (2010), that garnered sales of over 100,000 copies.

== Artistry ==

sentences: Artistry ==
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Just like the rest of Big Bang, Taeyang stands out for "how serious he is about his craft and artistry," in opposition to the rest of the "manufactured confines of K-pop."
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Through his older brother, Taeyang met pop music at the age of six, with the music of American singer Michael Jackson, since then he has developed his musical interest mainly influenced by genres soul and R&B.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: However, he became mainly an R&B singer and dancer, but is also known for fusing hip-hop, soul, and EDM with R&B in his solo albums.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Dazed claimed that his sound absorbs "style influences from punk to rap and twinning current underground R&B to his native, hyper-sonic pop music", while Allmusic described his material as "smart, hip-hop-flavored pop."
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Additionally, Billboard called him one of South Korea's "rare R&B stars."
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: For his second album Rise (2014), Taeyang stated that while "R&B and hip-hop are a given," "there is also electronic, ballad, and rock," hoping to blend genres like Kanye West.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Taeyang lists Miguel, Frank Ocean, The Weeknd and Michael Jackson as his biggest influences, in particular the latter's album Xscape.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Lyrically, he is known as a "specialist in love songs".
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: His debut single, "Only Look at Me", narrates a selfish relationship, while in "I Need A Girl" he describes his ideal type.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Taeyang's voice is highly praised for its tone.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Korean critic Kim Young-dae called his timbre "luxurious and one you couldn't find before him," noting that "instead of giving off a mechanically trained and cold aura that other idols usually exhibit, he has a warm and full emotional range."
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: In 2015, Taeyang was voted the third best K-Pop male vocalist by music industry officials.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: He was described as a "feline" and ferocious live performer by The New York Times.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Once described to have "moves like Chris Brown
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: [and] smooth vocals like Miguel," The Straits Times highlighted "his vocal prowess and sex appeal" as the best traits of his performances, and claimed that his free-styled moves show off "why he is often crowned the dancing king of K-pop."
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: A review of his first solo tour stated that:
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: Taeyang's vocals glide effortlessly over the melodies as his body twists fluidly from one move to the next.
section: == Artistry ==

sentences: But even as he dances in abandon, his movements are graceful and economical, a joy to watch.
section: == Artistry ==

== Achievements ==

sentences: Achievements ==
section: == Achievements ==

sentences: Throughout his career, Taeyang has sold an estimated 10 million records, making him one of the best-selling male South Korean R&B artists.
section: == Achievements ==

sentences: On November 23, 2010, Taeyang was presented with an award for his contribution to pop culture at the 2010 Korea Popular Culture and Arts Award Ceremony held by the South Korean Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism.
section: == Achievements ==

sentences: In 2017, he was appointed as an honorary ambassador for the 2018 Winter Olympics in Pyeongchang, being one of the Hallyu stars tasked with extolling the virtues of South Korea for the world.
section: == Achievements ==

sentences: Taeyang has earned two Golden Disc Awards, three Korean Music Awards, including Male Musician of the Year by Netizen Vote in 2011, three Melon Music Awards and four Mnet Asian Music Awards.
section: == Achievements ==

sentences: His song "Eyes, Nose, Lips", released in 2014, won Song of the Year in all major Korean awards, including Gaon Chart Music Awards, Golden Disc Awards, Melon Music Awards, and Mnet Asian Music Awards, making him the first R&B solo artist to do so.
section: == Achievements ==

sentences: The release of his first full-length album, Solar, was the first K-Pop music release to be sold worldwide on iTunes as both an audio and video album.
section: == Achievements ==

sentences: The audio version hit iTunes stores on August 19, 2010, while the video version arrived by September 10, 2010.
section: == Achievements ==

sentences: His second album Rise is debuting at number 112 on Billboard 200 chart.
